titlestmt.titleproper: Union League of Philadelphia miscellaneous records 1856-2000
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Union League of Philadelphia miscellaneous records

bioghist.p: The Union League of Philadelphia was founded in 1862 as a patriotic society to support the policies of President Abraham Lincoln. It evolved to its current identity as a non-sectarian and non-partisan private club.

scopecontent.p: Odds and ends which have been donated to the Union League Archives by members and friends, some purchased. Materials include information on other Union Leagues and Union League name products; minutes, founding documents, and correspondence of Republican Party affiliated organizations in Philadelphia, such as the Republican Club of Philadelphia, the Young Republican Club, and Company A, Republican Invincibles (some from the Porter F. Cope papers), as well as information on Republican Party Conventions held in Philadelphia in 1940, 1948, and 2000; and an electrical contractor journal of F. H. Hochrath from 1893-1895.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
